result.execSummary:
The defendant Damon F Judah was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Causing Mental Harm to Child, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.04(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
No contact with victim or victim's family without the victim, victim's family and probation agent's consent.
-----------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-----------------------------------

Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-----------------------------------

**AMENDED 12-08-2015 - BOND AMENDED TO ALLOW PHONE CONTACT WITH WIFE, KRISTA JUDAH ONLY. PARTIES ARE NOT TO DISCUSS THE CASE.**

Defendant Damon F Judah in court with attorney Jack C. Hoag.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter before the Court for preliminary hearing, but defendant wishes to waive hearing. Court goes over waiver form with the defendant. Information filed- reading waived. Minutes filed.  Arraignment scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

**AMENDED 12-08-2015 - BOND AMENDED TO ALLOW PHONE CONTACT WITH WIFE, KRISTA JUDAH ONLY. PARTIES ARE NOT TO DISCUSS THE CASE.**

Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.M.S. OR HIS SIBLINGS, OR HIS PARENTS, OR HIS GRANDPARENTS OR THEIR RESIDENCES. NO CONTACT WITH JUVENILES UNDER AGE 16 UNLESS SUPERVISED BY ANOTHER ADULT.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
